issues.description: The problem statement and template refer to an interface named Rideable (with method messageOnRide()), but the solution repository uses an interface named Mountable for the ride functionality and leaves Rideable.java empty. Specifically, Seal and Pig in the solution implement Mountable, while the UML and template Main refer to Rideable. This naming/type mismatch between the expected interface (Rideable) and the actual provided interface (Mountable) is inconsistent across artifacts and will confuse students (and automated checks) about which interface to implement and use.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make interface naming consistent across all artifacts. Preferred fixes:
- Rename the solution's Mountable interface to Rideable (or add a proper Rideable interface) and have Pig and Seal implement Rideable. Remove the unused/empty Rideable.java file or replace it with the correct interface declaration: public interface Rideable { String messageOnRide(); }
OR
- If Mountable is the intended name, update the problem statement and template references to use Mountable instead of Rideable. Ensure exactly one interface file exists and that classes implement that interface so students and tests are not confused.

issues.description: The exercise and UML refer to an interface named 'Rideable' (problem statement and template Main use Rideable), but the solution implementation introduces an interface named 'Mountable' and has classes (Pig, Seal) implement Mountable instead of Rideable. Additionally, Rideable.java in the solution repository is empty. This creates a direct naming mismatch for the same conceptual entity (the interface representing rideable animals) and will confuse students: the template/Main expects Rideable, but the concrete solution types implement Mountable, so the types do not line up across artifacts.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the interface name across all artifacts. Prefer the name used in the problem statement and template ('Rideable'): rename Mountable.java to Rideable.java (or delete Mountable and implement the Rideable interface), update Pig and Seal to 'implements Rideable', and remove or populate the empty Rideable.java in the solution repository. Alternatively, if Mountable is preferred, update the problem statement and template to reference Mountable consistently. This will restore a clear 1:1 mapping between the conceptual entity and its implementation.
